title: Government established due to collapse of Russia

content.description:
Snark/ Art Resource, NY

Poster from the Seventeenth Congress of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, 1934.

Poster text: “Raise the Flag of Lenin, It Gives Us Victory!”

Banners at bottom read: “Long live the invincible party of Lenin!” “Long live the great guide of the international proletarian revolution, Comrade Stalin!”
content.question: Which of the following directly enabled the establishment of the government that produced the poster?

choices.label: The collapse of the Russian Empire under the stress of the First World War
Redrawn national boundaries as a result of peace treaties ending the First World War
The abolition of serfdom and other forms of coerced labor in Russia during the nineteenth century
Increased ethnic violence in Russia due to imperial expansion in the nineteenth century

content.answer: The collapse of the Russian Empire under the stress of the First World War

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
